reviews.title: Practical and quick feature considering chaotic vehicle traffic.
reviews.text: The registration could facilitate when we are in a hotel, being able to put the address of the Hotel, plus it is very easily quiet to use, a pity that the points are just around miraflores, should have points along the entire edge.

reviews.title: Fantastic value all day hire for $AUD 21.
reviews.text: It was super easy to organize the voucher through TripAdvisor. They provide bicycles specifically dedicated to your size. I was staying in Miraflores and took a bus for 2 Sol to grab the bike. Diego spoke perfect English and, gave me a map and explained everything. In Mira Flores you are basically on dedicated bicycle lines so it is quite safe. Helmet and lock supplied Surprisingly the drivers respect the bicycle lanes and are careful. You could ride all the way into downtown but I'm not sure that's the greatest of ideas. I visited the ancient ruins site of Huaca Pucilano then headed for the coast and Ride Along the bicycle lane to the Morro Solar. I must admit you probably need Google Maps to work out exactly where you are at times. I had a great day hire from 9:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. what a bargain. I highly recommend it.

reviews.title: wonderful way to explore Lima
reviews.text: Kral was our guide - He was very helpful and kept us all very safe . His commentary on the sites of interest was clear , concise and informative. I highly recommend the tour.

reviews.title: Great way to spend a few hours
reviews.text: Everything from Beta’s warm welcome at the Gogo location, to Kral’s warmth / knowledge, to the safely chosen rout was fantastic.

reviews.title: Bike file is very good
reviews.text: Sundays are special days for cycling in Lima because the main avenues in Miraflores are closed to car traffic. I rented a city bike from GogoBiking for 3 hours. Valeria was super friendly and helpful, she recommended the itinerary to the historic center and the coast. Almost 40km of beautiful and fun tour with spectacular landscapes.

reviews.title: Good service and nice staff
reviews.text: Great service and attention to clients. Good bicycles. Good support by the nice staff. We would advise the rent for visiting the miraflores and barranco along the seaside.

reviews.title: Cheap way to explore the city
reviews.text: Bike was well maintained and it was a great and affordable way of exploring Lima at your own pace. The map was perhaps a little bit hard to follow, but otherwise a great experience

reviews.title: Nice ride
reviews.text: We did this tour when we visited Lima for a couple of days. Our guide was Jose, and he was very nice and patient. We enjoyed the ride but the portion going uphill to Cerro San Cristobal was very difficult for me.  The bikes provided were adequate for most of the ride and helmets were also available. They do not have lockers at the bike rental office but there is a corner where you can store backpacks, etc. since someone is always there. I would recommend doing this if you are in the area.

reviews.title: Renting a bike in Lima is a MUST!
reviews.text: I had an amazing experience here.  I rented for 2 days.  Renting a bike in Lima is an absolute must... you see so much of the city, the city is made for biking, you get exercise, and it's one of the fastest ways to get around and live like a local.  And if you rent, come here.  Super helpful, good bikes, and they will get you on your way!
